channel.title: Jarring problem
channel.description:
I have jarred many client before, and I know how to. I'm not asking for help on how to do it, I have a problem.
When I run my client with just the .bat file, it opens and runs fine. But, when I jar/sign the client, the client itself opens but it doesn't start loading at all.
There is something that spikes my mind and could potentially be a problem though. I keep my 'cache' folder right in the actual client folder so you don't have to download it. (Yes, it works. A lot of people do it) Maybe it could be a problem with loading the .jar file?

item.title: Jarring problem
item.dc:creator: @STOOPID STOOPID
item.description:
@STOOPID wrote:

Nebulae:

Have the client outside of the JAR and just set it to hidden.

I’m not understanding what you’re trying to say, please explain?

EDIT: I just edited signlink.java and cachedownloader.java to what I need and where to look for the cache and it works fine now. Although, thanks for the help!

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring problem
item.dc:creator: @Nebulae Nebulae
item.description:
@Nebulae wrote:

Have the client outside of the JAR and just set it to hidden.

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring problem
item.dc:creator: @STOOPID STOOPID
item.description:
@STOOPID wrote:

Nebulae:

Yeah that won’t work if you JAR the cache along with the client.

Thanks for the quick response. I’ll see what I can do about it, thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring problem
item.dc:creator: @Nebulae Nebulae
item.description:
@Nebulae wrote:

Yeah that won’t work if you JAR the cache along with the client.
